get.summary: This API returns Security Data points like Price, Number of Shares, Market Capitalization and other key attributes.
get.description: This API returns Security Data points like Price, Number of Shares, Market Capitalization and other key attributes.

parameters.name: entityId
parameters.description: MSCI Index Code or Module Name or reserve word ALL.

parameters.name: view
parameters.description:
MSCI Index APIs provide different 'views' of the data, respresenting the data at close of markets and before opening of markets on forward looking dates.

The initial view is used for computing Index Levels & Returns from Index constituents and verifying these against Index Levels and Returns retrieved using the performance API. For cross reference, this view returns Index Constituents as shown in end of day ICF files.

The full view is used for getting set of index constituents including Interim Constituents as well as PAF (Price Adjustment Factor), if any at market pre-open (before opening of market). For cross reference, Index Constituents from this view is constructed from the Market Open' Index & Security files. It is also similar to the 'Market Open' view shown in Index Monitor application.

The marketclose view is constructed from the initial sets of constituents for a given as of date and following as of date. It returns a list of Corporate Events associated with constituents. It shows how constituents evolve on the following business day, including events that are scheduled to be implemented at 'close of the current day and effective at open of the following day'. For cross reference, this view is similar to the 'Market Close' view shown in the Index Monitor application.

parameters.name: calc_date
parameters.description: The calculation date of the Index. Date in ISO 8601 format YYYY-MM-DD or YYYYMMDD. Calculation date is before or equal to today.

parameters.name: as_of_date
parameters.description: The current or future date for which forward looking data is requested. Date in ISO 8601 format YYYY-MM-DD or YYYYMMDD. calc_date <= as_of_date <= calc_date + Index Gap Period. 0 <= Index Gap Period <= 9

parameters.name: distribution_zone
parameters.description: The distribution cycle for which data is being requested. This parameter should not be used when an Index Code is specified in the entyId path parameter.

parameters.name: cumulative
parameters.description: Used in conjunction with distribution_zone. If true return all data distributed till given distribution_zone, if false only for given  distribution_zone

200.description: A JSON array of Index Performance data for Indexes matching the input criteria

get.summary: This API returns Security Data points like Price, Number of Shares, Market Capitalization and other key attributes.
get.description: This API returns Security Data points like Price, Number of Shares, Market Capitalization and other key attributes.

parameters.name: entityId
parameters.description: MSCI Security Code or Module Name or reserve word ALL.

parameters.name: view
parameters.description:
MSCI Index APIs provide different 'views' of the data, respresenting the data at close of markets and before opening of markets on forward looking dates.

The market open view of a given day represents the security at the opening of the market of that day. It includes interim constituents if any.

The market close view of a given day represents the security at the close of the market of that day. This means that the impact an event on that security during the market trading day is reflected on that security in its market close view (through for example a price adjustment factor).

parameters.name: calc_date
parameters.description: The calculation date of the Index. Date in ISO 8601 format YYYY-MM-DD or YYYYMMDD. Calculation date is before or equal to today.

parameters.name: as_of_date
parameters.description: The current or future date for which forward looking data is requested. Date in ISO 8601 format YYYY-MM-DD or YYYYMMDD. calc_date <= as_of_date <= calc_date + Index Gap Period. 0 <= Index Gap Period <= 9

parameters.name: distribution_zone
parameters.description: The distribution cycle for which data is being requested. This parameter should not be used when an Index Code is specified in the entyId path parameter.

parameters.name: cumulative
parameters.description: Used in conjunction with distribution_zone. If true return all data distributed till given distribution_zone, if false only for given  distribution_zone

parameters.name: data_frequency
parameters.description: This parameter specifies the frequency of publication of data points being requested. Data points like Index Levels are published daily, on each business day, while Index Ratios are published only at the end of the month

200.description: A JSON array of Index Performance data for Indexes matching the input criteria

get.summary: This API returns Index Levels, Performance (Returns) and other key attributes.
get.description: This API returns Index Levels, Performance (Returns) and other key attributes.

parameters.name: entityId
parameters.description: MSCI Index Code or Module Name or reserve word ALL.

parameters.name: view
parameters.description:
MSCI Index APIs provide different 'views' of the data, respresenting the data at close of markets and before opening of markets on forward looking dates.

The 'close' view of Index Performance API is the view of that Index after the close of the markets on the given calculation date.
The data returned by this API view is similar to the one published in 'INDEX REPORT' in the MSCI Core files and 'INDEX SAME DAY' in the MSCI ICF Files.

The 'divisor' view of Index Performance API represents the state of the Index at the opening of market on the next day as theoretically computed at the close of market on previous day.It provides the calculated initial Market Cap and the number of constituents in Index.
This view returns data as in the 'MARKET OPEN INDEX 'data set found in the 'Market Open Index' file.
Using the index divisor view, the users are able to retrieve Index Divisors for the next business day (T+1) and the number of securities in the Index & initial market capitalization of the index for the next two business days (T+1 and T+2).

parameters.name: calc_date
parameters.description: The calculation date of the Index. Date in ISO 8601 format YYYY-MM-DD or YYYYMMDD. Calculation date is before or equal to today.

parameters.name: as_of_date
parameters.description: The current or future date for which forward looking data is requested. Date in ISO 8601 format YYYY-MM-DD or YYYYMMDD. calc_date <= as_of_date <= calc_date + Index Gap Period. 0 <= Index Gap Period <= 9

parameters.name: distribution_zone
parameters.description: The distribution cycle for which data is being requested. This parameter should not be used when an Index Code is specified in the entyId path parameter.

parameters.name: cumulative
parameters.description: Used in conjunction with distribution_zone. If true return all data distributed till given distribution_zone, if false only for given  distribution_zone

parameters.name: index_variant
parameters.description: The variant for which Index levels are required  (e.g. STRD|GRTR|NETR|...). If not specified, Index Levels in all available variants are returned. Variant must be one of valid variants for given Index Code.

parameters.name: currency
parameters.description: The currency for which Index levels are required. 3 character ISO Currency Symbol. If not specified, Index Levels in all available currencies are returned.

parameters.name: data_frequency
parameters.description: This parameter specifies the frequency of publication of data points being requested. Data points like Index Levels are published daily, on each business day, while Index Ratios are published only at the end of the month

200.description: A JSON array of Index Performance data for Indexes matching the input criteria
